title: [Large-Scale] Hybrid Educational Course for Strengthening Basic Cardiac Point-of-Care Ultrasound (POCUS) Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of Basic Anatomy and Physiology, Understanding of Ultrasound Fundamentals
context.additional_context: Hands-on training program utilizing handheld ultrasound devices (e.g., Butterfly iQ)

learning_goals: Identify key cardiac structures (e.g., ventricular size, valve morphology) with 80% accuracy according to the cardiac POCUS standard protocol.
Independently acquire three basic echocardiographic views (PSAX, PLAX, A4C) using ultrasound probe manipulation techniques.
Achieve 32 points or higher (80%) on a 40-point knowledge test eight weeks post-learning.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
